  • Rating 8: In New York City, Emily Elizabeth Howard, a 12-year-old middle school student who lives with her English mother, Maggie, is regularly bullied by a popular girl at school named Florence, but finds comfort in her only new friend Owen Yu.
  • Rating 8: Maggie leaves her in the care of her van-dwelling and irresponsible uncle Casey before going to Chicago for a business trip.
  • Rating 10: Mr. Bridwell, who runs an animal rescue tent at a park, introduces Emily to a small red puppy whose family had been taken by dogcatchers.
  • Rating 10: He tells her that the puppy will grow based on how much love he receives.
  • Rating 10: Casey rejects the adoption due to dogs not being allowed in the apartment building.
  • Rating 3: When Emily gets home from school, she finds the puppy in her backpack and names him Clifford.
  • Rating 8: Casey allows her to keep Clifford only for one night.
  • Rating 10: The next morning, Clifford has grown to giant proportions.
  • Rating 10: Emily and Casey attempt to hide him from the building's superintendent, Mr. Packard.
  • Rating 7: They try taking Clifford to a veterinarian, but he chases and plays with a man in an inflatable bubble.
  • Rating 3: Word of his existence quickly spreads online.
  • Rating 3: After learning from the vet's secretary of Bridwell's past miracles with animals and their owners, the Howards plan to get information on his whereabouts.
  • Rating 10: As Emily is getting Clifford lunch from the cafeteria, Clifford escapes from Casey's truck and humiliates Florence, giving Emily the friends she always wanted.
  • Rating 3: Zac Tieran, the owner of biotechnology company Lyfegro, discovers Clifford on social media.
  • Rating 8: He lies to the police that Clifford is his dog and has them search for him.
  • Rating 4: After being evicted from their apartment and chased by the police and Lyfegro guards, Emily and Casey take shelter in Owen's lavish apartment.
  • Rating 3: Casey tells Emily she can keep Clifford if they find Bridwell and take his advice.
  • Rating 10: If he cannot help, Clifford must be sent to China, where Owen's father has a sanctuary.
  • Rating 10: They race to the hospital, only to find Bridwell's empty bed and a patient who tells them Bridwell has died.
  • Rating 10: Clifford is thus sent away by a boat arranged by Mr. Yu as Emily tearfully says goodbye.
  • Rating 6: The next day, Clifford is captured on the ship by Lyfegro personnel and sent to Lyfegro.
  • Rating 5: Emily soon learns Bridwell did not die, so she and Casey try to save Clifford from being operated on at Lyfegro, aided by friends from their neighborhood.
  • Rating 8: They break into Lyfegro's headquarters and rescue Clifford, who then flees through the city with Emily riding on him.
  • Rating 10: At Manhattan Bridge Park, a large crowd gathers as Emily desperately asks Bridwell to help, and he tells her that she must stand up for herself and for Clifford and that being different is a gift.
  • Rating 10: Emily explains to everyone the importance of love, regardless of differences.
  • Rating 10: However, Tieran, who arrived right after Emily finished her monologue, orders the police chief to see who Clifford's owner is by checking an page_name chip he had implanted.
  • Rating 10: When the chip identifies Emily as Clifford's rightful owner, the police arrest Tieran and inform him that he will be fined for lying to them.
  • Rating 10: Emily, Casey, and Maggie are welcomed back into their apartment.
  • Rating 3: Casey gets a job at Scholastic Corporation and moves out of his van.
